page.title: 10Memories of Stotfold
page.content: Mrs Brown is 91 years old and has lived in Stotfold all her life. Over the years she has noticed many changes.When she was a child she says "Everyone knew everyone else"Her old landlord drove around in a little horse and cart.He was the owner of the brickworks that was situated near the cemetery.This was destroyed when the A1 was built. She says there was very little industy in the area,"there was only the asylum and the farms".Her uncle collected and sold straw on Hitchin market to the hatmakers of Luton.The straw was sorted by women in Stotfold and taken to market on Tuesday. The rads in the village have improved greatly,and so to has the street lighting."We used to call Church Rd.Dark Lane"she recalls.
